FuncDef:
The inner-connect binding command binds internal communication interfaces on an AP and master.
The undo inner-connect binding command restores the default configuration.
By default, no internal communication interfaces on an AP and master are bound.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type and number of an internal communication interface on an AP.
The value is a three-dimensional Ethernet interface.

Specifies the type and number of an internal communication interface on a master.
The value is a four-dimensional Ethernet interface, and the first dimension is 1.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a port extension system, data traffic is transmitted through the internal forwarding channel between internal communication interfaces on an AP and master. To set up the channel, you must run the inner-connect binding command on the master to bind the internal communication interfaces.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
You must ensure that the binding configured using the command matches the actual physical connection. Otherwise, traffic between the master and AP cannot be forwarded.
The value of master-interface-type master-interface-number must be a local physical internal communication interface or an internal trunk interface's member interface. If an internal trunk interface's member interface is specified, you must ensure that the same internal trunk interface's member interface can only be bound to the same AP's internal communication interface.
